{{Unreferenced|date=April 2010}} {{Infobox Political Youth Organization | name_english = Turkey Youth Union | name_native = Türkiye Gençlik Birliği | colorcode = #EE0000 | logo = | chairperson = İlker Yücel | foundation = {{Start date|2006}} | headquarters = [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]] | ideology = [[Socialism]]
[[Kemalism]]
[[Left-wing nationalism]]
[[Euroscepticism]]
[[Anti-imperialism]] | mother_party = | international = | website = [http://www.tgb.gen.tr tgb.gen.tr] }}'''Turkey Youth Union''' ({{lang-tr|Türkiye Gençlik Birliği}}, TGB) is a Turkish [[left-wing nationalist]] political youth organization founded on 19 May 2006. It comprises 65 student clubs and societies from over 40 Turkish universities. Turkey Youth Union claims it advocates the principles of [[Mustafa Kemal Atatürk]] and [[Kemalist ideology|Kemalism]]. It has organized mass protests against the USA, EU, and the Turkish AK Party, and has been influential in Turkey's 2007 presidential elections as the preeminent representative youth organization of Turkey{{fact|date=May 2012}}. It opposes any future Turkish membership of the European Union and any cooperation with what it calls "American imperialism". Turkey Youth Union has opened [[Attila İlhan]] Cultural Centers in several cities to promote its values among young people. It's centers in [[Ankara]], [[Istanbul]], [[Izmir]], [[Eskisehir]] and [[Afyon]] are to be followed by new ones in [[Bursa]], [[Eskisehir]], [[Sivas]], [[Muğla]] and [[Denizli]]. ==External links== * [http://www.tgb.org.tr Türkiye Gençlik Birliği TGB (Turkey Youth Union)] * [http://www.tgb.gen.tr Türkiye Gençlik Birliği TGB (Turkey Youth Union)] [[Category:Activism]] [[Category:Student politics]] [[Category:Political organizations]] [[Category:Student political organizations]] [[tr:Türkiye Gençlik Birliği]]
